bioghist.p: Robert Lancaster Montgomery (b. 1929) began his career in 1954 as a pastor of the Spencer Presbyterian Church in Spencer, West Virginia, and in 1955 was employed by the Board of World Missions of the Presbyterian Church in the U.S. as a fraternal worker in Taiwan. There he held teaching posts at Yu-Shan Theological Institute and Taiwan Theological College. Montgomery served in Taiwan until 1972. Montgomery was a graduate of Southwestern University in Memphis (1950) and Columbia Theological Seminary (1953). He received a Th.M. degree from Princeton Theological Seminary in 1955 and a Ph.D. from Emory University in Atlanta in 1976.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of papers of Robert L. Montgomery. Materials include: General Assembly (Taiwan) reports, 1958-1964; copies of reports and minutes from various missions in Taiwan; reports from the Yu-Shan Theological Institute; school handbook (1961); a bibliography of Chinese theological books and bibliographies of source books on Taiwan; articles on Taiwan history; a manuscript draft of a biography of Chi Wang, translated by Mr. Covell; a small number of photographs and negatives of students in Taiwan; and postcards. Printed materials and photocopies include reprints, religions booklets in Chinese, works on demographics of Taiwanese (including works on names, tribes, occupations, and population studies), and works on the history of the Presbyterian Church in Taiwan and on the Mountain Church (congregations of aboriginal Taiwanese).
